text: The Chinese Elm cultivar Ulmus parvifolia 'Stone's Dwarf' was commercially released in the US in 1978. ==Description== The clone is distinguished by its rough, but not corky, bark.Stone, W. B., Intern. Bonsai, 3(1): 16-17, 1981. ==Pests and diseases== The species and its cultivars are highly resistant, but not immune, to Dutch elm disease, and unaffected by the Elm Leaf Beetle Xanthogaleruca luteola. ==Cultivation== 'Stone's Dwarf' is not known to be in cultivation beyond North America. ==Accessions== None known. ==References== Category:Chinese elm cultivar Category:Ulmus articles missing images Category:Ulmus
title: Ulmus parvifolia 'Stone's Dwarf'
